description: Mist-kissed waterfalls and monsoon rhythmsâ€”soundtrack for wandering Sri Lanka's cascading tea hills.

items.name: Rawana Ella: Widest Falls In Sri Lanka
items.description: Expect some crowd as Rawana is a popular fall in the country. One of the widest falls in Sri Lanka, it looks absolutely spectacular in the rains. The water level however decreases substantially during the off-season. It is named after Ravana who also appears in the Indian epic Ramayana. Undeniably, it is one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Sri Lanka.

items.name: Bopath Ella: Breath-Taking Cascade
items.description: Among many picturesque Sri Lankan waterfalls, Bopath is a unique one. It derives its name for its resemblance to the sacred Bo Leaf. The most striking feature is its shape, taken as it flows through two narrow rocks and then widens into a breath-taking cascade.

items.name: Dunhinda Falls: Smokey Surrounding Spray
items.description: There is no way you can miss Dunhinda while talking about most beautiful waterfalls in Sri Lanka. Formed by a diversion of Badulu Oya River, it is best known for a smokey surrounding spray.

items.name: Devon Falls: Perfect Escape Near Colombo
items.description: 19th among the highest waterfalls of Sri Lanka, Devon stands out for its lovely tiered formation. Named after an English (yes, again!) coffee planter, Devon is also popular as the Veil of the Valley. This is one of the most breathtaking waterfalls near Colombo.

items.name: Ramboda Falls: 11th Highest Waterfall
items.description: On an altitude of 945 meters above sea level, this scenic waterfall makes for a memorable experience. It is the 11th highest waterfall in the tea country. This is amongst the highest waterfalls in Sri Lanka.

items.name: Kirindi Ella: Impeccable Beauty
items.description: Amongst all the Sri Lanka waterfalls, Kirindi Oya Falls are a sight to behold. Just 5 km away from A4 highway, its one of the less famous waterfalls in Sri Lanka. The cascading stream forms a pool at the base, but the descent can be tiring.

items.name: Diyaluma Falls: Majestic View
items.description: 2nd highest among waterfalls of Sri Lanka and 6th highest in the world, Diyaluma Ella is an absolutely majestic view. It acquires a horsetail shape after falling and leaping over a cliff.

items.name: Bambarakanda Falls: Horsetail Fall
items.description: Surrounded by a dense pine forest, the highest waterfall in Sri Lanka is one of the most famous places to visit in Sri Lanka. This horsetail fall is formed by one of Walawe rivers tributaries.

items.name: Laxapana Falls: Serene Environ
items.description: Laxapana Falls is the 8th highest waterfall in Sri lanka. According to the popular folklore, this is the place where Buddha mended his saffron robe, while visiting Sri Pada. This rocky waterfall get its name from the Sinhala words Laxa meaning hundred thousand and pahana meaning rock.

items.name: Elgin Falls: Delightful Sights
items.description: The beautiful Elgin Falls was named after the Elgin major town of Moray in Scotland. The waterfall is picturesquely visible when travelling in a train for Nanu Oya to Ambewela.

items.name: Aberdeen Falls: For Nature Lovers
items.description: Aberdeen Waterfall is amongst the most popular waterfalls in Sri Lanka and is located on the Kehelgamu Kya near Ginigathena in Nuwara Eliya. A visit to this stunning fall will surely give a refreshing touch to your Sri Lankan vacation!

items.name: Alakola Falls: Refreshing Break!
items.description: Another popular waterfall in Sri Lanka is Alakola Ella. It is also known as Thaliya Wetuna Ella and is located in the mesmerizing estate of Alakola being surrounded by the Knuckles mountain range in Matale of Central Province. This beautiful waterfall has been named after a famous tea planter, Allen Collen who used to be active during the colonial era. It is undoubtedly one of the most beautiful waterfalls in Sri Lanka.
